dialogues.speaker: EXT JABBERJAW
dialogues.text: Leonard gets a PAPER out of a VENDING MACHINE - He reads the headline - "HEADLESS MAN FOUND IN LUMBERYARD Leonard reads it for a beat - Walter then approaches, carrying a box -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Leonard!  Beautiful morning, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was. Leonard lowers the paper - his face drops -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have in the box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait till you see this! Walter opens the box and removes the contents - It is the HEAD of the carpenter - Walter shoves the sculp Leonard's face - Leonard drops the paper and staggers back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsamatter Leonard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made...a bust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gleefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah isn't it wonderful? Leonard takes a few steps back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsamatter Leonard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down, Walter. Walter's smile fades, and he puts the head down - Leonard him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter...Walter listen carefully. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to make any more statues.  Do you understand? No more statues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Why not?  I gotta make statues Leonard.  You heard Maxwell, they want me to make them. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back to being a busboy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maxwell!  He's behind all this with all his stupid blowhard poetry! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you've got to stop right away!  I'm beginning to feel responsible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, w-what did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind... Leonard puts his arm around Walter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter...I decided to have that show for you, right away. Walter walks with Leonard -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Carla comes by I'll talk to her.  She'll make up some nice invitations.  We'll have them printed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well invite the critics, and the art collectors...we'll tell them...

dialogues.speaker: INT CARLA'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: INSERT INVITATION - a fancy invitation to the Jabberjaw t the work of Walter Paisley - Mayolia fixes up the back of Carla's dress - Cuff and Lin chairs, and Maxwell fumbles with his tie, dressed formall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't see why we can't go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Leonard De Santis is afraid to have you come.  You who buy his coffee, his potables, his food. You are the heart and soul and meat of the Jabberjaw. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he slighted you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get an invitation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not!  But I'm going anyway. Not to drink his champagne but to see Walter's triumph. Just then Walter walks through the front door, dressed to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that we go no more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya Maxwell. Maxwell pats Walter's arm -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't say good luck, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would imply you could not succeed on your ability alone! Maxwell dramatically exits - Walter watches him, then heads over to Carla, and smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look so handsome. Walter looks down at his outfit -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do? Walter then looks at Carla -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you. Cuff and Link crack up at his comment -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you look so pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?  We've got plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  But I wanted to talk to you. Carla looks at Walter for a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok... Carla grabs her coat and bag -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go now if you like. Walter and carla head out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break a leg. Walter and Carla head out, closing the door behind them -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, why do you suppose Walter wants to get her alone? (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suppose he could be physically attracted to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man, he ain't the type.  He don't get enough vitamin E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maxwell gave him a bottle of wheat germ oil.  Maybe he started taking it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: Walter and Carla walk down the street - Walter says nothing -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice night out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm... The two say nothing for a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...what did you want to talk to me about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...w-what kind of people do you like, Carla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know.  Smart people. Creative people I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm creative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means you like me! Carla looks at Walter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you very much, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you did on account of you kissed me the other night! Carla sees where this is going and doesn't like it - the walking -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that was for your sculpture of the girl.  Your nude in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla - Walter tries to arrange his thoughts -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, I've been alone for a long time, and I know you've been alone because you never seem to go out with anybody - Walter looks nervously at his hands -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - even though Leonard's always asking you to go out with him and I - just -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say? Walter gestures for Carla to sit down at a nearby bench - down - Walter swallows appearing very nervous -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to make statues anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get married. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you. Carla senses trouble -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...how long have you been thinking about this, Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...f-for a long time.  Ever since you first came to the club. Carla looks down at the ground -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the only one who was ever nice to me! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you loved me until you kissed me. Carla suddenly feels very awkward - she takes a deep brea prepares for the rejection -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, I really do like you. And I did kiss you.  But... that was because of your work. Walter listens intently to every word -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more to being in love than just that. Carla gives a sympathetic look to Walter - Walter doesn't a beat, as if putting two and two together -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean...you don't love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla looks down at the ground -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that's what I mean. Walter begins to get very upset -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you gotta love me! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think I made that statue of Alice?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just can't be sorry! I wanna - I wanna marry you! Carla looks around -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now calm down Walter! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's go in there, and when the show's over, maybe we can talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I want to talk about it now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hurt your feelings but there is no way we're ever going to get...together.  You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just friends.  That's all. Just friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it.  I see the whole thing now. No one knows if Walter Paisley is born!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, what is your problem all of a sudden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure, let's string along poor Walter, see how far it will take us! Carla gets up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're starting to freak me out, Walter.  I'll see you there. Carla heads off - Walter watches her leave -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to love me, Carla...

dialogues.speaker: INT JABBERJAW
dialogues.text: The hoi polloi of the art community mingle at the private On display are Walter's creations - Dead Cat, Murdered Ma Strangled Girl and his bust of the carpenter's head - People talk about the works in muted voices, as if they a serious works of art - Art, the undercover cop, is also there, eyeing the room - Maxwell takes an hors d'oeurve off a passing tray, and no someone offscreen - Walter sits alone, dejected - a waitress presents him wit champagne glasses - Walter looks up at the tray -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. The waitress walks away - The plump man talks to an ART CRITIC -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have many artists about but no craftsmen. The critic gestures to the voluptuous figure of Strangled

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man knows his anatomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd give five thousand for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you've read my review it will probably cost you ten thousand. The critic and the plump man laugh - Maxwell swaggers over to Walter, putting his empty glass champagne on a passing tray and grabbing up another - He puts his hand on Walter's shoulder -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the problem? Leonard watches them from across the room -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why on Earth should you be so depressed?  Have you heard some of the things they've been saying? You can make fifty thousand on these pieces alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't respect money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't!  But fifty thou?  That's not money, that's manna! Walter gets up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. Walter sees Carla - He gets up and heads over to her - Carla glares back at him  - Walter looks at her with a st in his eyes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about what I said before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla, would you do one favor for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about anything, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you let me make...a statue of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla smiles -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you really like to?  That would make me very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok...tonight.  I'll make a statue of you tonight, OK? Carla smiles and nods - then her smile fades - Leonard takes a sip of champagne and notices something ac room - Cuff and Link have crashed the party - they head over and look at Murdered Man - Leonard puts his glass down and heads over to them -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuff takes his cigarette and jams it in the mouth of Murd Leonard approaches -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, we've come to make the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't invited.  Now get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we're not good enough to get a private show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right!  And we're not open for business!  This is an art exhibit!  No bums! Leonard pushes them out the door as Cuff grabs his cigare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you're the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right right - goodbye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright, we got a pressing engagement!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right outside the door! Leonard closes the door behind them - Carla is looking at the collection - she inspects Dead Ca carpenter's head - She then approaches Strangled Girl - She smiles, drinking sculpture - Then she sees something that troubles her -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh - oh. She looks closely at one of the hands - a FRACTURE has fo of her fingers - Carla gently goes to touch it when the piece CRACKS OFF - Carla picks up the piece and goes to put it back - She sees a HUMAN FINGER protruding from the sculpture - Carla stands back, in shock - She looks around the room - soon shock turns to horror - She makes a bee-line for the front door but is stopped by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going Carla? Whatsamatter? Carla is mute with terror for a beat, but manages to get words -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter...there's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's...a body inside that statue! Walter smiles innocently -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's Alice. Carla is speechless -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, Carla. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maxwell said it's alright. Walter takes a few steps closer -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them become clay in his hands so that he might mold them. Carla is clearly frightened -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter...stay away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see Carla?  I made them immortal. Walter takes a few steps closer -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see?  I can do the same for you! Carla waits for a second, then SHOVES Walter out of the w out the door - Walter looks around to see if anyone is looking - Nobody is - He takes this opportunity to BOLT out the door in pursuit

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: Carla runs down the street as fast as she can - Walter follows, in hot pursuit -

dialogues.speaker: INT JABBERJAW
dialogues.text: The critic stands in front of Strangled Girl - Art approa behind - The critic has noticed the EXPOSED finger -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'll be.  Look at this! A WOMAN approaches -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another work...inside this work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Heavens!  It looks...like a real finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's unparalleled...reality cased in layers...concealed in a shield of whiteness, blankness... Art scrutinizes the finger - several other people begin t admiring the discovery -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...that's reality alright - Art does not like what he sees - Art heads over to murdered man - He inspects the hand - sees a RING shape on one of the fi A horrible realization forms in Art's mind - he grabs a B off a table and begins to chip away at the hand - Maxwell sees this, begins to stumble over to it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely what are you doing! Art breaks the plaster off the fingers - he inspects the Lou's finger -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou...Lou! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! Everyone spins around as Art grabs a chair - SWINGS IT at Man - There is a loud CRASH as Leonard watches Art hit the scul whole crowd then SCREAMS - the jig is up -

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: Carla continues to flee from Walter - Walter appears to be gaining some ground - Carla turns a corner -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Walter then follows her around the corner -

dialogues.speaker: INT JABBERJAW
dialogues.text: Art, Maxwell, and the critic run over to an ashen-faced L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call 911 get a patrol car down here - I'm going to get Paisley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going with you!

dialogues.speaker: EXT JABBERJAW
dialogues.text: Art, Maxwell and the critic burst out the front door - Cu see them -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey what's the deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Paisley is a murderer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man he just chased Carla down the street - Art, Maxwell and the critic head off - Cuff and Link foll running -

dialogues.speaker: INT JABBERJAW
dialogues.text: Leonard is on the phone, biting his nail -

dialogues.speaker: EXT ALLEY
dialogues.text: Carla ducks down an alley and crouches behind a dumpster by some garbage cans - Walter turns into the alley, and looks around - Carla freezes - Walter then SPOTS HER - He lunges after her, but Carla throws some garbage cans i him and runs away - Walter throws the cans aside and continues to chase her -

dialogues.speaker: EXT LUMBER YARD
dialogues.text: Carla runs into the yard and hides behind a large stack o Walter then approaches, looks around, then suddenly - Walter looks around - Carla hides, but inadvertently KNOCKS OVER a piece of woo Walter hears it rattle across the ground - he runs toward
Carla grabs a bookshelf-sized PLANK as Walter approaches Walter freezes for a beat, a manic expression on his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back Walter... Walter starts to approach -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back Walter! Walter lunges and WHAM!  Carla slams the plank over Walte he hits the ground - Carla runs off in the direction she came from - Walter staggers to his feet, clutching his head - he look not knowing which direction Carla went - he runs in the o direction -

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: Walter runs down the street, stopping to catch his breath continues to run down the street -

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: Carla runs into Art as he pursues Walter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - he's flipped out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? Carla gestures with her head and Art takes off -

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: Art runs down the street, pulling out his REVOLVER -

dialogues.speaker: EXT ALLEY
dialogues.text: Walter runs down the alley -

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: Cuff and Link runs down the street, followed by Maxwell a Maxwell stops to catch his breath - Carla pushes him forward - the critic follows -

dialogues.speaker: EXT COURTYARD APARTMENTS
dialogues.text: Walter looks around the street, desperate - He then looks toward his house, and runs to the gate -

dialogues.speaker: EXT COURTYARD
dialogues.text: Walter flies through the gate - Mrs. Swicker approaches - Walter nearly CHECKS her into t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the name of - Walter opens his door and slams it behind him -

dialogues.speaker: INT WALTER'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Walter locks the door - Walter looks around the room, panicking - he accidentally Carla's picture to the ground -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do now Walter? Walter looks in his closet - Walter then looks up, as if getting an idea - He begins to frantically barricade his door -

dialogues.speaker: EXT COURTYARD
dialogues.text: Mrs. Swicker points at Walter's door as Art, Maxwell, Cuf Carla, and the critic run toward it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in there - he's gone crazy! Art tries the door -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paisley!  Open the door!

dialogues.speaker: INT WALTER'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Walter frantically mixes the plaster in the trough - He looks back at the relentless banging at his door, and plaster with increased fury -

dialogues.speaker: EXT COURTYARD
dialogues.text: By this time a whole crowd of people have assembled at Wa - Art, Maxwell, and Leonard alternately kick and bash the door begins to give -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harder! They continue to bash the door until finally -

dialogues.speaker: INT WALTER'S ROOM
dialogues.text: CRASSHHHH!!! The door bursts open and Art, Maxwell, Leona Cuff, Link and the critic all stumble in, pushing aside a obstacles - Everyone begins to pour in but as they look ahead, there collective gasp - They are looking at Walter, HANGING from a NOOSE, and cov dripping plaster - The crowd gathers around Walter in stunned silence - Carla looks remorsefully at Walter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...Walter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable...this will command a small fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose he would have called it Hanging Man... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...his greatest work. PULL BACK to reveal the room of spectators, looking at Wa final creation -

dialogues.speaker: THE END
dialogues.text: (function(i,s,o,g,r,a,m){i['GoogleAnalyticsObject']=r;i[r (i[r].q=i[r].q||[]).push(arguments)},i[r].l=1*new Date(); m=s.getElementsByTagName(o)[0];a.async=1;a.src=g;m.parent })(window,document,'script','//www.google-analytics.com/a ga('create', 'UA-67290913-1', 'auto'); ga('send', 'pageview');
